title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, color, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.1, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/1/code_of_conduct.html. title: Contributing to r5rgui
text: can fix typos, spelling mistakes, grammatical errors documentation directly using GitHub web interface, long changes made source file. generally means ’ll need edit roxygen2 comments .R, .Rd file. can find .R file generates .Rd reading comment first line.

title: Contributing to r5rgui
text: want make bigger change, ’s good idea first file issue make sure someone team agrees ’s needed. ’ve found bug, please file issue illustrates bug minimal reprex (also help write unit test, needed). See guide create great issue advice.

title: Contributing to r5rgui
text: Fork package clone onto computer. haven’t done , recommend using usethis::create_from_github("e-kotov/r5rgui", fork = TRUE). Install development dependencies devtools::install_dev_deps(), make sure package passes R CMD check running devtools::check(). R CMD check doesn’t pass cleanly, ’s good idea ask help continuing. Create Git branch pull request (PR). recommend using usethis::pr_init("brief-description--change"). Make changes, commit git, create PR running usethis::pr_push(), following prompts browser. title PR briefly describe change. body PR contain Fixes #issue-number. user-facing changes, add bullet top NEWS.md (.e. just first header). Follow style described https://style.tidyverse.org/news.html.

title: Contributing to r5rgui
text: New code follow tidyverse style guide. can use styler package apply styles, please don’t restyle code nothing PR. use roxygen2, Markdown syntax, documentation. use testthat unit tests. Contributions test cases included easier accept.

title: Contributing to r5rgui
text: Please note r5rgui project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project agree abide terms.

what: r5rgui: Simple Shiny GUI for r5r
title: r5rgui: Simple Shiny GUI for r5r
text: goal r5rgui allow user interactively explore routes calcualted {r5r} package Shiny app, e.g. troubleshooting routing problems.

title: r5rgui: Simple Shiny GUI for r5r
text: Get CRAN: get latest development version R-Universe: can also install development version r5rgui GitHub : Also setup Java r5r package:
code: install.packages("r5rgui") install.packages(   "r5rgui",   repos = c("https://e-kotov.r-universe.dev", "https://cloud.r-project.org") ) # install.packages("pak") pak::pak("e-kotov/r5rgui") # install.packages('rJavaEnv') # if not installed yet  # install and use Java 21 in current session rJavaEnv::use_java(21)

title: r5rgui: Simple Shiny GUI for r5r
text: basic example shows solve common problem:  demo runs internally simple example code: Therefore can replace data_path data path explore routing network.
code: library(r5rgui) r5r_gui_demo() library(r5r) data_path <- system.file("extdata/poa", package = "r5r") r5r_network <- build_network(data_path = data_path, verbose = FALSE) r5r_gui(r5r_network, center = c(-51.22, -30.05), zoom = 11)

what: Run the r5rgui Shiny Application — r5r_gui
title: Run the r5rgui Shiny Application — r5r_gui
text: function launches Shiny application provides graphical user interface 'r5r' package, allowing interactive transit routing.

title: Run the r5rgui Shiny Application — r5r_gui
code: r5r_gui(   r5r_network,   center = NULL,   zoom = NULL,   departure_date = Sys.Date(),   mode = c("WALK", "TRANSIT"),   basemaps = list(Positron = mapgl::carto_style("positron"), `Dark Matter` =     mapgl::carto_style("dark-matter"), Voyager = mapgl::carto_style("voyager")) )

title: Run the r5rgui Shiny Application — r5r_gui
text: r5r_network pre-built 'r5r' network object, named list objects comparison. list provided, list names used labels GUI. single object provided, variable name used label. center numeric vector length 2, specifying initial longitude latitude map's center. NULL (default), map centered bounding box r5r_network. {r5r} version 2.4.0, calculating bounding box may slow. zoom integer specifying initial zoom level map. NULL (default), zoom level automatically calculated fit bounding box r5r_network. {r5r} version 2.4.0, calculating bounding box may slow. departure_date Date object specifying initial departure date trip. Defaults current system date. mode character vector specifying initial transport modes. passed directly mode argument detailed_itineraries() (functions r5r). Defaults c("WALK", "TRANSIT"). basemaps named list MapLibre style URLs (style generator functions like mapgl::carto_style()). names used GUI selector. Defaults set Carto styles (Voyager, Positron, Dark Matter). See mapgl styling helpers options.

title: Run the r5rgui Shiny Application — r5r_gui
text: function return value; launches Shiny application.

title: Run the r5rgui Shiny Application — r5r_gui
code: if (interactive()) {   # First, build the r5r network   library(r5r)    # Note: This requires a valid r5r network.   # Using the sample data included in the r5r package:   data_path <- system.file("extdata/poa", package = "r5r")   r5r_network <- setup_r5(data_path = data_path)    # Launch the application without specifying center and zoom   # The map will be automatically centered and zoomed to the network's extent   r5r_gui(r5r_network)    # Launch with a specific departure date with auto-zoom and center   r5r_gui(r5r_network, departure_date = as.Date("2019-05-13"))    # Launch with specific transport modes   r5r_gui(r5r_network, mode = c("WALK", "BUS"))    # Manually define map center and zoom   map_center <- c(-51.22, -30.05)   map_zoom <- 11   r5r_gui(r5r_network, center = map_center, zoom = map_zoom)    # Compare two networks   # Note: For this example, we use the same network object twice.   # In a real scenario, you would use two different networks (e.g. current vs future).   r5r_gui(list("Baseline" = r5r_network, "Scenario A" = r5r_network)) }

what: Run a Demonstration of the r5rgui Application — r5r_gui_demo
title: Run a Demonstration of the r5rgui Application — r5r_gui_demo
text: simple wrapper function launch r5rgui Shiny application using sample Porto Alegre dataset included r5r package. function designed ease use demonstration purposes. automatically handles setup r5r_network object provides default map settings (center zoom) appropriate sample data.

title: Run a Demonstration of the r5rgui Application — r5r_gui_demo
Run a Demonstration of the r5rgui Application — r5r_gui_demo
text: mode character vector specifying initial transport modes. Defaults c("WALK", "TRANSIT").

title: Run a Demonstration of the r5rgui Application — r5r_gui_demo
text: function return value; launches Shiny application.

title: Run a Demonstration of the r5rgui Application — r5r_gui_demo
text: function first locates sample data within r5r package, calls r5r::setup_r5() build routing core. Finally, launches Shiny app calling r5r_gui() pre-configured objects. Please note r5r may need download sample data first use, requires internet connection.

title: Run a Demonstration of the r5rgui Application — r5r_gui_demo
code: if (interactive()) {   # To run the demo application, simply call the function:   r5r_gui_demo()    # Run with specific transport modes   r5r_gui_demo(mode = c("WALK", "BUS")) }

title: r5rgui 0.2.0
text: New Compare Mode: Added toggle switch Normal Compare modes, allowing users compare two routes side--side independent settings. Multi-Graph Support: r5r_gui() now accepts named list r5r_network objects, enabling comparison different network scenarios (e.g., “Current” vs. “Future”). Map legends now display routing execution times summary statistics (total duration/distance). Compare Mode, two independent legends shown top corners easy comparison. Route 1 Route 2 use distinct color palettes (Blue/Orange vs. Green/Teal). Refactored layout 3-column design collapsible resizable sidebars. Moved control buttons dedicated toolbar. Repositioned notifications bottom-right prevent overlap. mapgl basemaps support Reproducible Code: Updated “Copy R Code” generate script single dual routing requests, correctly referencing specific network objects list. Added Quit button exit application. Improved error handling notifications routing failures.

title: r5rgui 0.1.0
text: CRAN release: 2025-11-25 Copy R Code button copy code reproduce exact route currently displayed map (2025-09-05)
